articles.author: April Ehrlich OPB
articles.description: A budget crisis a century in the making is coming to a head as Oregon’s rural counties wait on Congress to approve funding they’ve long relied on.
articles.title: ‘We are sinking’: Oregon timber counties flail, awaiting Congress to renew key funding

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: DRAIN — Ame Beard said she spent months planning the mermaid party with a group of people in Drain, after she was approached with the idea at another themed party she had thrown.
articles.title: Drain residents hold mermaid party upon request

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: SUTHERLIN — Ramona Briggs brought her 1959 Chevy El Camino to the Sutherlin Blackberry Festival car show Saturday, displaying the red vintage vehicle in the grass in Sutherlin’s Central Park.
articles.title: Sutherlin Blackberry Festival: Car show, mud volleyball, BMX racing and more all weekend

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police seized 16 dogs, firearms, and ammunition after an investigation into an alleged illegal breeding operation. A 66-year-old man faces 17 counts of animal neglect and firearm charges following the Aug. 18 incident.
articles.title: Police Seize Dogs, Firearms in Roseburg Animal Neglect Case

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Jonathan Dowdy of Coos Bay pleaded guilty to multiple charges in the April crash that killed UCC coach Jami Strinz and player Kiley Jones and injured eight others. Several counts were dismissed in a plea deal. Sentencing in Coquille is set for Sept. 11.
articles.title: Coos Bay Driver Pleads Guilty in UCC Softball Bus Crash

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Winston City Council tabled a proposal to limit RV park stays and advanced Ordinance 75-724, which includes zoning and animal code updates and would allow recreational marijuana facilities in the city. The measure proceeds to further review and public input.
articles.title: Winston Council Passes Marijuana Facility Ordinance, Tables RV Park Stay Limits

articles.description: Umpqua Community College has begun building a $21.5 million Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub. Opening in early 2027, it will centralize student services and expand medical training, backed by an $8 million state match and support from local partners.
